name: Perspective (itch) (juzek)
description:
This game is more of a commentary on mental health, and how the world can look different through whatever lenses / experiences you see through. 

It is framed as a puzzle platformer, where your characters are also blocks that you use to help each other get through the level to the next door. 

Characters:

The dark gray character has depression. They can't notice pleasant things, or color as much, and their special ability is taking naps. They have less energy (can't jump) and they feel the ceiling is closer to them than it is and can't hear the melody of the music. 

The yellow character has a phobia / panic attacks related to the pink things as shown through the music changes and sprite swaps. Their special ability is dashing.  

The cyan character has dysmorphia, and has trouble perceiving their actual size.  Their special ability is jumping high.

Controls:

•WASD to move and jump (if able), 

•Spacebar to use the special ability.

•Tab to switch characters

It is currently very buggy, and I am sorry about that. Just lower your expectations. I have verified that every level is solvable.  Just ask if you want help with any of them. 

Anyone from Sweet and Power Sauce, I'm sorry, but I need little side projects to get me through the big one. Think of this as a prototype for a next thing
